Sprout is designed by music lovers, for music lovers.Sprout is high definition, playing the purest quality files up to 192kHz/24-bit (trust me, that's a good thing).

Sprout takes you back to the music's source in a warm, friendly sort of way.  No remote control, just a solid connection between you and your music.  Feel the precision.  Put the tactile beauty of control back in your hands. Reach out for Sprout!
Add headphones or speakers to Sprout, and your music will come alive. You can adios the dock.
It's big, awkward, and hard to use.  You shouldn't need a degree in electrical engineering to love music in your home.  Sprout is simple and elegant and brings the artists into your living room!
You've got a great source—unleash it on Sprout by Bluetooth or USB, and you'll hear your music for the first time.
42 years ago PS Audio released our first product: a phono-stage amplifier.  We've been doing it ever since.  We cherish our LP's. Use Sprout to draw every drop of analog purity from your records.
Every Sprout comes with this adapter:

Sprout delivers.  Concert-quality audio in your home?  That's pretty remarkable if you think about it.  Yo Yo Ma's strings should sound like a cello.  You should be able to distinguish Simon from Garfunkel.  My dad and I are insatiable sound hounds.  We believe the pursuit of live sound is a journey, not a destination.
You should join us.  It's going to be fun.
Don't miss this chance to own Sprout!
There will never be a better opportunity to bring Sprout home. Help me bring music and magic into the world.

Sprout has sold thousands of units at $799...but thanks to its success we're able to offer it now at $499!  This is an incredible opportunity  to score the amazing Sprout personal music system at a very low price, and fill your home with the sound of live music like you've never experienced before!
Inputs: Phono (Moving Magnet), Analog (3.5mm), USB (asynchronous 192kHz/24-bit), Digital Coax (any sample rate and bit depth up to 192kHz/24-bit), Bluetooth (built in).
Stereo power Amplifier 4Ω 50W (drives any size speakers)
Analog output: variable 3.5mm line, for subwoofer or otherwise.
Read what audio and design experts say about Sprout:

Herb Reichert, Stereophile: ""With Sprout, I always enjoyed the way I felt when a song ended and the next one began. I took pleasure in how I would go from smiling satisfaction to eager anticipation. Sprout specialized in the beguiling reproduction of every kind of music I sent through its four inputs. Recommended to style-conscious, value-seeking human beings of all ages, genders, and heights. You go, little Sprout!""

Caleb Denison, Digital Trends: ""It seems most audio gear manufacturers are woefully out of touch with what normal people want/need. Thankfully, there are a few audio companies that just get it, and PS Audio proves it’s one of them with its latest effort, the Sprout integrated amplifier.""

Ken Kessler,  The Telegraph(UK):""Financed in part by crowdfunding, the Sprout is a gorgeous device that turns audio minimalism into an objet d’art. It is a low-profile, square footprint component reminiscent of the Mac Mini, with only two controls on the front. It’s as if one of the first of its design criteria was an absolute denial of technofear.""

Lee Scoggins, Headphone Guru :""The Sprout has turned out to be one of the most fun and versatile audio components I have ever used. It does just about everything and it introduced me to (finally!) some decent Bluetooth sound.""Gregory Han, Design Milk :""I knew I was starting on the right foot when I found an amplifier seemingly designed specifically for the segment I represented: a design-minded customer who wanted to upgrade to entry-level audiophile components. I knew I wanted something small, yet sufficiently powerful and flexible for a variety of sound sources, whether it be a turntable, a laptop, or streaming wirelessly. When I noted PS Audio’s literature made mention of both Braun’s Dieter Rams and Apple’s Jony Ive as guiding inspiration for their user experience, it was apparent this audiophile company had factored in design prominently into their plans.""
...and what the press says about PS Audio:

John Darko, DigitalAudioReview.net: ""PS Audio ensures you're looked after each step of the way: the packaging, customer support, website, YouTube channel and firmware upgrades are solid examples of this manufacturer’s innovative ambition."" (PerfectWave DAC)

Marja & Henk, 6moons.com: ""We firmly believe that we can now speak of the beginning of the second digital revolution... Kudos to PS Audio for being at the very front lines staking out this exciting future."" (PerfectWave Transport & DAC)

Anthony Cordesman, The Absolute Sound: ""PS Audio’s NuWave Phono Converter is truly an innovative product with great sound and value for the money. A real pleasure to review...."" (NuWave Phono Converter)
Karl Sigman, Audiophilia.com: ""PS Audio has perhaps achieved the impossible with the DS [DirectStream]. The DS gets my highest recommendation
column2: hats off and a bow to PS Audio."" (DirectStream DAC, winner of Publisher's 'Star Component' award).

column1: There is no risk! PS Audio has been a leading maker of high-end audio gear for over 40 years. Sprout has been available now for a year, and thousands of units have been sold at $799. Thanks to our success and experience we've managed to restructure manufacturing and sales, and can now offer Sprout at $499!The only challenge here is restraining yourself from buying a Sprout for every name on your holiday shopping list!",8.0,1,"4 Campaigns

column5:
>

        

The First Levitating Turntable visually enhances the experience of listening to vinyl records by levitating the platter. By joining our love for music with careful integration of technology and high-range audio components, we’ve created a turntable of the future for the medium of the past.
column9: >
column10: >
column11:
>

At MAG – LEV Audio we love innovation and music. We were searching for a way to give people a better, newer way to experience vinyl records. By pushing the frontier of audio technology, we were able to integrate the uplifting experience of music into the turntable design itself, bringing the feeling of zero gravity into your living room.

column3:
showinfo=0"">
 

The First Levitating Turntable is designed for people who appreciate high quality sound and innovative design. It comes with a Pre-Fitted tonearm and cartridge. This setup allows you to connect through phono in. Once you’re done, you just have to pick your favorite record, turn the turntable on, move the tone arm into position and lower the cueing lever. Then sit back, relax and enjoy.
column5:
>

We understand how important your records are to you, so our turntable lifts the tonearm at the end of your record. This function keeps your records from being scratched and also prolongs the life of the cartridge.
column6:
>

When it comes to vinyl, the cueing mechanism plays a vital role in the listening experience. The gentle drop and the precision of the needle is what make the entire process feel even more satisfying. Picking your favorite song becomes simple and even beautiful.
column7:
>

 You can switch between 33,3-rpm and 45-rpm with just a turn of a button. To ensure you have everything you need, we’ve supplied you with a 45-rpm adapter, so you can enjoy all types of records.

column2:
>

We’ve added platter feet, which allow the platter to rest in OFF mode. These feet automatically retract when you begin using the turntable. When the tonearm is placed back in its original position, the platter feet will automatically rise up and you can safely switch off the turntable.
column6:
>

Accidents happen, and we know that sometimes you may encounter a power outage, so we’ve designed the turntable with a UPS system. This solution stores enough power to safely lift the tonearm, stop the record, and return the platter feet to resting position. This way the turntable and your record remain in perfect condition even when the unexpected happens.
column9:
>


We’ve added subtle orange lighting, which gives the turntable a sleek, futuristic feel, and further enhances the visual effects of levitation even when the lights are off.
column11:
>

The drive system in this turntable is where all the magic is. It is completely different than anything else on the market. By using our innovative and patented technology, we were able to achieve not only magnetic levitation, but we’ve also been able to maintain the incredibly precise turning of the platter with sensor regulating software. Air is the smoothest medium with least amount of friction, which further elevates this project into a truly unique listening experience.

column5: >
column13:
>


For all Indiegogo supporters shipping is free. Thank you for believing in our story.
column16:
>

Damir Islamovic / Freelance, Designer

Klemen Smrtnik / Desnahemisfera, Designer

Dejan Kos / Desnahemisfera, Designer

Sebastijan Smrtnik / Freelance, Electrical Engineer

Tomaz Pegan / Topsol, Technology Expert

Aleksander Pegan / Topsol, Technology Expert

Davorin Furlan / Topsol, Logistics Expert

Tadej Doles / Production Expert

MAG-LEV Audio team got together through shared love for music. The team is full of enthusiastic and experienced individuals coming from various fields such as design, engineering, production and logistics. The complexity of this project required lots of knowledge and hard work. Together we have brought our dream project to life and we are excited about what lies ahead. You may know Desnahemisfera design studio for their successful product on Kickstarter, Goat Story Goat Mug, whereas Topsol works with advanced solar technology, supplying the world with green energy.

","The First Levitating Turntable visually enhances the experience of listening to vinyl records by levitating the platter. By joining our love for music with careful integration of technology and high-range audio components, we’ve created a turntable of the future for the medium of the past.             At MAG – LEV Audio we love innovation and music. We were searching for a way to give people a better, newer way to experience vinyl records. By pushing the frontier of audio technology, we were able to integrate the uplifting experience of music into the turntable design itself, bringing the feeling of zero gravity into your living room.

column1: The First Levitating Turntable is designed for people who appreciate high quality sound and innovative design. It comes with a Pre-Fitted tonearm and cartridge. This setup allows you to connect through phono in. Once you’re done, you just have to pick your favorite record, turn the turntable on, move the tone arm into position and lower the cueing lever. Then sit back, relax and enjoy. We understand how important your records are to you, so our turntable lifts the tonearm at the end of your record. This function keeps your records from being scratched and also prolongs the life of the cartridge.When it comes to vinyl, the cueing mechanism plays a vital role in the listening experience. The gentle drop and the precision of the needle is what make the entire process feel even more satisfying. Picking your favorite song becomes simple and even beautiful. You can switch between 33,3-rpm and 45-rpm with just a turn of a button. To ensure you have everything you need, we’ve supplied you with a 45-rpm adapter, so you can enjoy all types of records.

We’ve added platter feet, which allow the platter to rest in OFF mode. These feet automatically retract when you begin using the turntable. When the tonearm is placed back in its original position, the platter feet will automatically rise up and you can safely switch off the turntable. Accidents happen, and we know that sometimes you may encounter a power outage, so we’ve designed the turntable with a UPS system. This solution stores enough power to safely lift the tonearm, stop the record, and return the platter feet to resting position. This way the turntable and your record remain in perfect condition even when the unexpected happens.  We’ve added subtle orange lighting, which gives the turntable a sleek, futuristic feel, and further enhances the visual effects of levitation even when the lights are off. The drive system in this turntable is where all the magic is. It is completely different than anything else on the market. By using our innovative and patented technology, we were able to achieve not only magnetic levitation, but we’ve also been able to maintain the incredibly precise turning of the platter with sensor regulating software. Air is the smoothest medium with least amount of friction, which further elevates this project into a truly unique listening experience.

For all Indiegogo supporters shipping is free. Thank you for believing in our story.   Damir Islamovic / Freelance, DesignerKlemen Smrtnik / Desnahemisfera, DesignerDejan Kos / Desnahemisfera, DesignerSebastijan Smrtnik / Freelance, Electrical EngineerTomaz Pegan / Topsol, Technology ExpertAleksander Pegan / Topsol, Technology ExpertDavorin Furlan / Topsol, Logistics ExpertTadej Doles / Production ExpertMAG-LEV Audio team got together through shared love for music. The team is full of enthusiastic and experienced individuals coming from various fields such as design, engineering, production and logistics. The complexity of this project required lots of knowledge and hard work. Together we have brought our dream project to life and we are excited about what lies ahead. You may know Desnahemisfera design studio for their successful product on Kickstarter, Goat Story Goat Mug, whereas Topsol works with advanced solar technology, supplying the world with green energy.       Bright Visuals - VideoPeter Giodani - PhotoSašo Kalan - SoundMaša Pavoković - Communication coordinatorIntek - Audio equipmentTrilogic - IT supportLjubljana Exhibition and Convention Centre - VenueKSEVT Cultural Centre of European Space Technologies - VenueNiko Klanšek - SupportSlovenia Crowdfunding Meetups Tomaž Toldi and Cyndi Ovsec - Legal advisorsTomaž Grom - Patent advisor",54.0,1,"1 Campaign

We are a London based start-up that launched in January 2017 and are currently members of Google Campus
column2:
a Google community specifically for start-ups. We currently have two products readily available on the market and the Cylinder 2.0 will be our next product, we expect to deliver the Cylinder 2.0 in March 2018.  

During our research we found that most loud bluetooth speakers were heavy and unattractive. Whilst most smaller portable speakers available on the market lacked volume and style. The few decent speakers we found cost in excess of $140, we feel that customers are being massively overcharged for good quality audio products. So we set out to make a stylish alternative for customers by going direct to consumer and deliberately not using wholesalers and distributors.  

The AVIOX Cylinder 2.0 is our solution to this problem. It’s an innovative, slick, aluminium portable, bluetooth speaker that will fit seamlessly into any apartment or house. The specification is on par with the very best portable speakers currently on the market. Continue reading to learn more about what makes the cylinder 2.0 different and why we need your support.
column4:
showinfo=0"">

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

CUSTOMIZATION 

Simply send us your artwork, name or initials. We will etch this onto the aluminium part of the speaker or print on the side latex cone. We can even remove our logo if you wish and replace it with your own artwork/symbol.  

The etching area available on the aluminium is 1 cm X 20 cm (at the bottom of the speaker were our current logo is). Your artwork will be compressed to fit this area.  

If you choose to print on the side latex cone the area available is a 2 cm radius (from the center of the circle to the edge). You can choose any color you wish using this print method. Select the £59 pledge and we will contact you immediately after the campaign to get your exact requirements.  

All customized units will be delivered in March 2018.

 

Risks and challenges

We have nearly 1 year experience in delivering speakers across the globe so we have given ourselves plenty of time to ensure backers receive their rewards in a timely fashion. In the unlikely event that we fall behind schedule, we will keep backers updated.

We want our backers to enjoy their speakers for years to come so we are giving a 2 year manufacturers warranty. Our manufacturing factory has a very meticulous quality control team but if your speaker stops working for whatever reason please get in touch and we will find a prompt solution.

column1: Accompagné de sa guitare acoustique et de sa musique à bouche, Sergio fabrique des ponts. Avec ses mots, il construit des liens entre le fleuve de la vie, les rives des émotions, et la terre des hommes.
Choisissez d’emprunter les passerelles mélodiques de son ""Folk anecdotique du quotidien"" et vous découvrirez la nature humaine sous toutes ses formes.

Autodidacte, autonome et débrouillard,  j'ai suivi une multitude de formations privées et semi-privées avec des gens reconnus dans le milieu tel que: Daran, Tire le Coyote, Patrice Michaud, Claude Vallières, Mario Chénart, Marc Chabot, Patric Saucier, Marie-Claire Séguin, etc.

C’est à l’automne 2014 que je fais le grand saut et que je m’inscris à l’École Nationale de la Chanson pour apprendre tous les rouages du métier qui me passionne : Auteur-compositeur-interprète. J'en suis d'ailleurs diplômé depuis juin 2015.

Fort de toute cette expérience j'ai décidé de mettre à profit tout mon temps à la réalisation de chacune des étapes de mon projet artistique personnel, et ce, de façon complètement autonome. J'y ai mis, et y mets encore mon coeur et mes tripes ...
Il en résulte un premier EP officiel de 6 chansons qui verra le jour à la fin avril 2017 sous la réalisation de « Tire le coyote » et de « Shampoing ».

Ce mini-album est important pour moi, car il deviendra ma carte de visite auprès du public, de l'industrie musicale, et des médias ... Il me permettra de me positionner artistiquement dans le paysage musical québécois.

J'ai déjà financé moi-même les coûts d'enregistrement en studio, les salaires des musiciens et des réalisateurs. J'ai besoin de vous pour la conception visuelle de la pochette (graphisme), l'impression du disque et de la pochette ainsi que tout le volet promotionnel de l'album (relation de presse, pistage radio et lancement).
Pour ce faire, j'ai besoin pour réaliser mon projet d'amasser un montant de 3500$
Lancement (Location de salle, scénographie, technicien de son, musiciens) 425$

Que ce soit en achetant l'album en prévente ou en choisissant une des offres exclusives de produits et services offertes uniquement durant la campagne de financement, vous contribuerez grandement au succès de ce projet qui me tient vraiment à coeur !

Même si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer, peu importe la raison ... vous pouvez quand même aider mon projet en lui faisant de la publicité, en passant le mot à vos amis, en partageant ma campagne de financement à vos contacts et amis via les réseaux sociaux (courriel, Facebook, etc.) Votre participation à ce niveau fera toute la différence !
Mon plus grand défi est d'intéresser le plus de gens possible à mon projet. C'est pour cette raison qu'il est primordial que vous partagiez cette campagne à vos amis afin de leur faire découvrir !
De mon côté je m'engage à utiliser une stratégie de marketing tout au long de la campagne afin de faire connaître mon projet au plus de gens possible.
B i o g r a p h ie
SERGIO touche la guitare pour la première fois à l’âge de douze ans accompagnant l’accordéoniste folklorique pour le réveillon du 31 décembre que son père organise.
C’est ensuite par le rock que SERGIO réalisera ses premières expériences musicales professionnelles. Fortement inspiré du mouvement « Grunge » il forme le groupe « Nucléair Jet ».

Ce projet lui permettra notamment de jouer en première partie de Michel Pagliaro au Grand Théâtre de Québec, de France D’Amour lors des festivités entourant la fête du Canada à Montmagny, de Daran au mythique bar spectacle le D’Auteuil et de réaliser une tournée d’une durée d’un mois en Argentine.

SERGIO assumera plusieurs responsabilités dans ce projet. Auteur, « Booking », Pistage radio. Il réussira d’ailleurs à faire monter trois extraits de l’album « Rêve Univers » dans le top 10 BDS du palmarès et de faire jouer les chansons du groupe dans plus d’une trentaine de stations de radio du Québec en passant par le Nouveau-Brunswick et l’Ontario.

Autodidacte, autonome et débrouillard, SERGIO a depuis suivi une multitude de formations privées et semi-privées avec des gens reconnus dans le milieu tel que: Daran, Tire le Coyote, Patrice Michaud, Claude Vallières, Mario Chénart, Marc Chabot, Patric Saucier, Marie-Claire Séguin, etc.

C’est à l’automne 2014 qu’il fait le grand saut et qu’il s’inscrit à l’École Nationale de la Chanson pour apprendre tous les rouages du métier qui le passionne : Auteur-compositeur-interprète. Il en est d'ailleurs diplômé depuis juin 2015.

Fort de toute cette expérience il décide de mettre à profit tout son temps à la réalisation de chacune des étapes de son projet artistique personnel, et ce, de façon complètement autonome. Il en résulte un premier EP officiel de 6 chansons qui verra le jour à la fin avril 2017 sous la réalisation de « Tire le coyote » et de « Shampoing ».

SERGIO  est un faiseur de ponts. Avec ses mots, il construit des liens entre le fleuve de la vie, les rives des émotions et la terre des hommes. Lorsque nous choisissons d’emprunter les passerelles mélodiques de son « Folk anecdotique du quotidien » pour venir à sa rencontre, nous y découvrons la nature humaine sous toutes ses formes …

Lorsque nous choisissons d’emprunter les passerelles mélodiques de son « Folk anecdotique du quotidien » pour venir à sa rencontre, nous y découvrons la nature humaine sous toutes ses formes …",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column2: boutique pedal builders. SPS stands for Studio Power + Switching, and sets a new standard for what is possible in a compact guitar pedal form factor. Here is a list of features packed into one small circuit.

column1: • Relay switching controlled by a microcontroller. The relay is non-latching, and will switch to bypass if power is lost. The microcontroller lets you control the relay with any momentary ON-OFF switch.
• Charge pump boosts 9V input voltage to approximately +/- 15V for dual-supply circuits. This type of power is commonly found in analog rackmount studio gear, not compact guitar pedals.
• Internal switch and dedicated connection point allow for easy integration of a buffered switching option.
• DualMode allows the user to toggle from standard latching operation to a momentary mode that only activates the effect while the footswitch is held down.

• Top-mounted audio and power jacks can fit into the compact 1590B2 or 1590BS form factor.
• Many connection points aligned for easy connection to the effect PCB using a single ribbon cable.

I have set a modest startup goal of $5000 to enable a production run of the SPS system PCB. The manufacturing cost lowers significantly if we can raise over $10,000, so I have added some pretty sweet stretch goals.
• $5,000 - minimum amount needed to make a run of SPS system PCBs (unlocked)
• $7,500 - 5 additional DIY effects will be made available (unlocked)

• $15,000 - Current output of the charge pump circuit will be increased

I have stopped manufacturing pedals in general, so these are available exclusively through this Indiegogo campaign. NOTE - While you will be asked for some custom details at checkout, you will not be asked which effect you want. I will gather this information after the campaign ends.

Check out the full library of pedals at vfepedals.com/discontinued (does not include RUP). This includes demo videos and an interactive diagram of how each pedal works.

The Standout mid booster was the direct sequel to the Focus mid booster. So what makes them different in this campaign? Nothing major. The bottom line is that I only had enough custom dual-gang pots remaining to build a limited run of the Standout, which has sold out. However, I can re-configure the board to work the same way as the original Focus. Here are the only differences between the two pedals:

#1 - HPF = TIGHT and LPF = SMOOTH, but in reverse. Both controls work the same, but in the Focus, turning clockwise lowers the cutoff frequency.
#2 - The Focus is available at the $200 custom pedal tier. The Standout is NOT available as a custom option.
#3 - The graphic will be different. In the image above, the Standout is on the left and the Focus is on the right.
For information about my current plans to change/update each pedal, check out the update posted on October 14.

column1: If we do not raise a minimum of $5000 through this campaign, then I cannot move forward on any of these 3 things.
Parts of the funds will be used to re-design the original VFE Pedal lineup, in preparation of a re-launch of these pedals by a 3rd party in 2021.

I have successfully funded and filled perks for 7 crowdfunding campaigns, and have built thousands of pedals over the past 12 years. I have made multiple prototypes and am ready to start finalizing the design for large-scale manufacturing. While I am confident that I can deliver every perk in this campaign, here are some factors that could delay the projected timeline.
• Backordered parts - if a part I need is back-ordered at the factory, it could delay production by 1-2 months.
• Quality control - if it takes multiple attempts to get the assembly house to produce the SPS System to my exacting standards, it could 2-4 weeks.
• Alignment with teaching schedule - if the above delays shift production enough to prevent me from using my breaks in the teaching schedule to build pedals, it could add further delays.
The projected ship dates for each perk has factored in these potential delays already, and I will send updates with and new projected ship dates if there will be any manufacturing delays.

Some of the original VFE Pedals that have already been re-designed for use with the SPS system - Old School tremolo, White Horse compressor, Merman overdrive, Standout mid booster, Pale Horse overdrive and Dragon overdrive.
There are multiple ways you can support me and this campaign. Here are two other ways to help:
• Use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools to spread the word! The best people to share with are fellow pedal-obsessed musicians and DIY enthusiasts.
• Follow my teaching journey at vofe.design/education and help fund ambitious student projects at IDEA High School.

column1: My name is Peter Rutter, and I teach math & circuits at IDEA High School in Tacoma, WA. In 2010 I launched a guitar pedal company called VFE Pedals. As I transition away from running a pedal manufacturing company to part-time design work, I wanted to design something to give back to the DIY & boutique builder community that had helped me so much over the past decade.

Pinout from SPS system - +9V, send to input of effect, buffer output from effect, negative voltage rail from charge pump, ground, positive voltage from charge pump, return from output of effect, LED voltage output, momentary footswitch connection, bypass indicator voltage (goes high when pedal is off), and oscillator output from charge pump

The SPS System is my love letter to DIY & boutique pedal builders. SPS stands for Studio Power + Switching, and sets a new standard for what is possible in a compact guitar pedal form factor. Here is a list of features packed into one small circuit.

Relay switching controlled by a microcontroller. The relay is non-latching, and will switch to bypass if power is lost. The microcontroller lets you control the relay with any momentary ON-OFF switch.
Charge pump boosts 9V input voltage to approximately +/- 15V for dual-supply circuits. This type of power is commonly found in analog rackmount studio gear, not compact guitar pedals.
Internal switch and dedicated connection point allow for easy integration of a buffered switching option.
DualMode allows the user to toggle from standard latching operation to a momentary mode that only activates the effect while the footswitch is held down.
Overvoltage and reverse voltage protection diodes, plus a power inductor to significantly filter out noise & interference on the power line.
Top-mounted audio and power jacks can fit into the compact 1590B2 or 1590BS form factor.
Many connection points aligned for easy connection to the effect PCB using a single ribbon cable.

I have set a modest startup goal of $5000 to enable a production run of the SPS system PCB. The manufacturing cost lowers significantly if we can raise over $10,000, so I have added some pretty sweet stretch goals.
$5,000 - minimum amount needed to make a run of SPS system PCBs (unlocked)
$7,500 - 5 additional DIY effects will be made available (unlocked)
$10,000 - ENIG plating upgrade to all SPS system PCBs (unlocked)
$15,000 - Current output of the charge pump circuit will be increased
$20,000 - P3 phantom power system added to all SPS system PCBs. This would give an extra power option using standard TRS cables instead of separate cables for power & audio signal.
A pedal built with an early prototype of the SPS system. I used this prototype to tweak/tune the circuit and make updates to use in the production version.
9V in, 29V out. The built-in charge pump converts +9V into about +/- 15V. The voltage output is not regulated and varies based on total current draw.
There are several perks, but they all fall into 3 basic categories:
SPS System - get fully assembled PCB(s) to use in your next project. Jacks & PCBs to build VFE effects are optional add-ons at different perk levels.

Barebone kits - get the fully assembled SPS system, pre-drilled enclosure, pots/jacks/switches, and empty PCB of the effect of your choice. The full list of available PCBs can be found from the effects listed at vfepedals.com/discontinued (all except the RUP). I will create a Mouser part list for each kit to help you source the resistors, capacitors, diodes, transistors, ICs, and other small components.

Fully assembled pedals - I am making a custom run of pedals in the summer of 2020. I have stopped manufacturing pedals in general, so these are available exclusively through this Indiegogo campaign. NOTE - While you will be asked for some custom details at checkout, you will not be asked which effect you want. I will gather this information after the campaign ends.

All 26 original VFE Pedals are available through the custom pedal perk (see above). Each pedal will be updated with the SPS system, and include hand-painted graphics. See the image below for a comparison between the original VFE Pedal and one built with the new SPS system & hand-painted graphics.
Check out the full library of pedals at vfepedals.com/discontinued (does not include RUP). This includes demo videos and an interactive diagram of how each pedal works.

The Standout mid booster was the direct sequel to the Focus mid booster. So what makes them different in this campaign? Nothing major. The bottom line is that I only had enough custom dual-gang pots remaining to build a limited run of the Standout, which has sold out. However, I can re-configure the board to work the same way as the original Focus. Here are the only differences between the two pedals:#1 - HPF = TIGHT and LPF = SMOOTH, but in reverse. Both controls work the same, but in the Focus, turning clockwise lowers the cutoff frequency.#2 - The Focus is available at the $200 custom pedal tier. The Standout is NOT available as a custom option.#3 - The graphic will be different. In the image above, the Standout is on the left and the Focus is on the right.
For information about my current plans to change/update each pedal, check out the update posted on October 14.
The money raised from this campaign will be used to accomplish 3 things:
The SPS system will enable the DIY & boutique builder community to design & build with a studio-grade dual-supply power system and durable relay switching.
I will use a portion of the funds to remake the original VFE Pedal lineup in a new form factor, as I prepare them for licensed manufacturing by another company.
5% of the total amount raised will be donated to 63 6c 75 62, a student club that designs & builds custom solutions to benefit the student body at IDEA High School in Tacoma, WA.
If we do not raise a minimum of $5000 through this campaign, then I cannot move forward on any of these 3 things.
Parts of the funds will be used to re-design the original VFE Pedal lineup, in preparation of a re-launch of these pedals by a 3rd party in 2021.

I have successfully funded and filled perks for 7 crowdfunding campaigns, and have built thousands of pedals over the past 12 years. I have made multiple prototypes and am ready to start finalizing the design for large-scale manufacturing. While I am confident that I can deliver every perk in this campaign, here are some factors that could delay the projected timeline.
Backordered parts - if a part I need is back-ordered at the factory, it could delay production by 1-2 months.
Quality control - if it takes multiple attempts to get the assembly house to produce the SPS System to my exacting standards, it could 2-4 weeks.
Alignment with teaching schedule - if the above delays shift production enough to prevent me from using my breaks in the teaching schedule to build pedals, it could add further delays.
The projected ship dates for each perk has factored in these potential delays already, and I will send updates with and new projected ship dates if there will be any manufacturing delays.

Some of the original VFE Pedals that have already been re-designed for use with the SPS system - Old School tremolo, White Horse compressor, Merman overdrive, Standout mid booster, Pale Horse overdrive and Dragon overdrive.
There are multiple ways you can support me and this campaign. Here are two other ways to help:
Use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools to spread the word! The best people to share with are fellow pedal-obsessed musicians and DIY enthusiasts.
Follow my teaching journey at vofe.design/education and help fund ambitious student projects at IDEA High School.

column3:
>

Inspired by Montessori principles (as well as the cassette players of our youth), Yoto is an audio player that works with physical cards to give children back control over what they choose to play.  

At its heart, Yoto is a modern take on a children’s Hi-Fi, with the clever stuff that comes from being ‘connected’, but without the concerns that come with open access to the internet.  

Yoto plays a wide range of content: from favourite nursery rhymes and songs to get the kids dancing, to classic stories from authors like Roald Dahl, as well as podcasts and radio from around the world.

From learning the alphabet with phonics, and practising scales on the piano, to sound-effects for role-playing and acting out - Yoto is smart, but safe, and lots of fun, and we’re proud to show you what it can do.
column4:
>

Children simply choose a card they like, and slot it in the top of Yoto to make that content play. It’s as simple as that! 

Yoto comes with enough cards to get you started, and you can order more cards at any time to be posted directly to your door. You can even make your own custom cards from songs and content you already own. 

You can also choose to join the Yoto Club and, based on your child’s age and interests, we will curate a selection of cards that get delivered throughout the year, with content that evolves as your child develops.
column5:
>

Children love being in control - and with Yoto they control when they listen to content - but ultimately, via the Yoto parents app, you’re in control of what your kids listen to.  

It’s a balance that we feel can get lost with other internet connected devices. Voice-recognition speaker systems can be great, but feel a bit creepy when used by children. Screen based gadgets like smartphones and tablets are amazing, but there's always the nagging fear of what’s three clicks away from that cute cat video on Youtube.  

Yoto addresses both concerns. It doesn't have a microphone or camera to spy on your children. And its carefully curated ecosystem allows no access to internet nasties.

And throughout two years of testing Yoto with families in their homes, we’ve seen how well it works - for children and their parents.

column1: The strength of Yoto is in the quality and range of the cards we offer, and we’re working flat out behind the scenes, building a library of content that we are truly excited about.

UPDATE (November 17th):  We are thrilled to be able to announce that we are now working the Roald Dahl Literary Estate to bring the characters and stories from the world's number one storyteller to the Yoto Library.
Out of the box, Yoto will come with enough cards to ensure there is always something new to listen to. That’s because of the six smart ways that Yoto works:

This is the foundation on which the Yoto library is built, with stacks of cards that play all your favourite music and stories, as well as new ones you may not have heard yet.  

Music to get them dancing, nursery rhymes to sing along to, classical music (because it’s awesome) and modern hits to release their inner pop star.

We are teaming up with the good people at Roald Dahl to bring you stories like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Fantastic Mr. Fox, The BFG and much more.

As well as that, we have stories like the Three Little Pigs and Beauty and the Beast, the best of Beatrix Potter’s Peter Rabbit all commissioned by us with fresh narrations, as well as the best modern children’s literature reworked for Yoto - for which we are already in talks with some more of the best-loved children’s authors.
Where Yoto comes into its own, with cards that are interactive and educational. Designed around Montessori principles, learning can become a fun family activity.

Yoto can support language development with Phonics Cards, help them learn to count all the way to 100 with Numbers Cards, learn Shapes and Colours with cards that can also be used outside of Yoto as flash cards. Yoto can even help them start to master a second language with a range of content for the budding multi-linguist.
Tap into a world of family radio, with cards that stream live radio content from channels around the world, all hand picked by our team of editors.
(You could even use Yoto to listen to Radio 4 while you make the dinner - if you can drag your kids away from it.)

We are incredibly excited about podcasts, and the way they have opened up a world of ideas and thinking that is changing the way programming works. Podcasts are amazing - but it can be tricky to find the good ones from within all that choice. And playing them has always involved a screen, up to now.
Your Yoto cards automatically update to play the most recent podcasts from a particular show, and we scour the globe to bring you the best new dollops of wonderfulness.
Even without cards, Yoto can surprise, delight and inform - every day.

Yoto Daily is your daily update of the seasonal and the topical. Count down to Christmas with our advent calendar, hear a poem on World Poetry Day, get a funny joke to tell you friends, find fun facts to fascinate a fellow fellow, celebrate the first day of Spring, or the last man on the moon.
Yoto Daily can even tell you what the weather will be each day, which is actually really cool.
Got a library of 5,000 songs already? No problem - simply upload an album through the app and we’ll send you a Yoto card to make it play (or you can decorate your own 'mix tape' cards with stickers).
Want to record your own version of the The Three Little Pigs? Who wouldn’t? - just fire up the app and get huffing and puffing!

Got grandparents who miss the little ones in between visits? Sounds like us - if you download the app for them, recording a personalised story is as easy as making a phone call. And since the story is on the card, your child can hear it over and over again, whenever they like.

Yoto started with a hunch, that there must be a way to bring music and stories - and even connected content - to our own children without having to resort to phones and screens, and without having to dig the old CD player out of the loft.
But we knew we needed to test our ideas with other families, so we could be sure we were on the right track.
We’ve been sharing Yoto prototypes with families for the last two years, and without wanting to blow our own trumpet, we know it works.
We’ve seen early toddlers starting to explore a world of audio with nursery rhymes and animal sounds, right up to great big tweens getting hooked on science podcasts.
But don’t just take our word for it, watch our early prototype testers explain their experience with Yoto.
RFID Card Slot - cards activate content with RFID technology
Raspberry Pi - we are proud to use this wonderful mini (full) computer in Yoto
16x16 pixel LED display - 256 pixels allows us to illustrate basic concepts without getting in the way of the audio experience
WiFi - Yoto connects to Wifi to stream live radio and to download new content
5W Audio - Yoto sounds good - no tinny sound here
Illuminated Surfaces - the side and top surfaces of Yoto can illuminate to help bring audio content to life
Buttons - two simple buttons allow you to skip content forward or back, and to adjust the volume

A Word on Openness
We don't believe in closed, proprietary technology or walled gardens so we plan to make Yoto as open a platform as possible, with APIs to allow developers to interface with Yoto.

column2: >

column1: Yoto was founded by Ben and Filip back in 2015 with a vision to make exciting technology and music products that kids can control without screens. Along the way, we have assembled a team of experts from the worlds of content, product design, technology, marketing and manufacturing as well as an experienced set of advisers and investors.
Our team has a strong track-record in building companies and delivering software and hardware projects.
Tom, our Industrial Designer, is a Red Dot Design Award winner and has developed products that Apple chose to sell on its Apple Store.
Ben helped build dotmusic (bought by Yahoo!) and then founded a digital music platform called 7digital - taking it public in 2014
Filip is our technology whizzkid and created the 7digital API - used by companies like Samsung and Spotify
Anthony founded and sold music marketing agency Frukt
Carly has worked at Disney and Sony and has delivered projects for Lego and Kidzania
Sarah is a ‘DigitalMum' and co-founder of the Great British Mums network
Yoto is first and foremost a labour of love for all of us, and we are taking a values-driven approach to everything we do.

We want the best for our children, and we want the best for your children, too. As a way to capture this way of thinking, we have started compiling the Yoto Manifesto, which is our promise that we'll always stay true to what we believe:
It's been quite a journey to get here. The last two years has consisted mainly of: burning our fingers on the soldering iron in Filip's shed
column3: trying not to cry as our prototypes got mauled by toddlers
column4: feeling elated as our improvements started to work
column5: and raising enough money to keep the lights on, and our dreams alive.

column1: Along the way, we've been lucky to have support from friends, family and generally nice people to help us out, and for that we're truly grateful.
Here are some photos from our journey over the last two years...
We're determined to deliver a great product to our backers, and to do so on time. And our team has years of experience delivering hardware projects, so this is not our first rodeo.

Because we know - as the saying goes - hardware is hard, we've been developing Yoto from the outset with manufacturing in mind. And for a while now we've been speaking with our trusted network of partners - like plastics tooling and moulding people, and electronics design and manufacturing specialists - to help us develop a design that flows smoothly into production. 

We plan to make the first batch of Yoto right here in the UK, so that we can be on the ground to work closely with these partners, and get Yotos to our backers quickly.

We have a Press Kit for journalists and bloggers. Or you can email us directly at hello@yotoplay.com or get in touch by social media. We need your help to tell people about Yoto! Please share our campaign with your friends and families.

Yoto on Facebook  
Yoto on Twitter
Thanks for taking time out to discover Yoto. Please back us and help us get the word out.
With gracious thanks, Ben, Filip, Tom, Anthony, Carly and Sarah and the families behind Yoto.

This campaign would not have been possible without the help of many people. A special thanks to Luke, Gideon, Bernie and Sarah and the Roald Dahl Literary Estate team, Rob and the BEAR team, Bart, Alex, Phoebe @ Objekt Films, Dave @ David Burton Photography, Jon, Paul and Niko @ Pimoroni, the team at Machines Room, Edspace, Jan @ Emerge, Tom @ BleepBleeps, Stephen Somerville, Alyssa Tisné, Helena Ambrosio, Steve Redmond, Ania, Peter Papp, Nina, Sofie + Lily, Susan and kids, Rob and kids, Chris Sice, Paul Ashton, Alex Johnston, Rainy Dias, Nina Mistry and many more...

Out of the box, Yoto will come with enough cards to ensure there is always something new to listen to. That’s because of the six smart ways that Yoto works:

This is the foundation on which the Yoto library is built, with stacks of cards that play all your favourite music and stories, as well as new ones you may not have heard yet.  Music to get them dancing, nursery rhymes to sing along to, classical music (because it’s awesome) and modern hits to release their inner pop star.

We are teaming up with the good people at Roald Dahl to bring you stories like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Fantastic Mr. Fox, The BFG and much more.As well as that, we have stories like the Three Little Pigs and Beauty and the Beast, the best of Beatrix Potter’s Peter Rabbit all commissioned by us with fresh narrations, as well as the best modern children’s literature reworked for Yoto - for which we are already in talks with some more of the best-loved children’s authors.
Where Yoto comes into its own, with cards that are interactive and educational. Designed around Montessori principles, learning can become a fun family activity.

Yoto can support language development with Phonics Cards, help them learn to count all the way to 100 with Numbers Cards, learn Shapes and Colours with cards that can also be used outside of Yoto as flash cards. Yoto can even help them start to master a second language with a range of content for the budding multi-linguist.
Tap into a world of family radio, with cards that stream live radio content from channels around the world, all hand picked by our team of editors.
(You could even use Yoto to listen to Radio 4 while you make the dinner - if you can drag your kids away from it.)

We are incredibly excited about podcasts, and the way they have opened up a world of ideas and thinking that is changing the way programming works. Podcasts are amazing - but it can be tricky to find the good ones from within all that choice. And playing them has always involved a screen, up to now.
Your Yoto cards automatically update to play the most recent podcasts from a particular show, and we scour the globe to bring you the best new dollops of wonderfulness.
Even without cards, Yoto can surprise, delight and inform - every day.

Yoto Daily is your daily update of the seasonal and the topical. Count down to Christmas with our advent calendar, hear a poem on World Poetry Day, get a funny joke to tell you friends, find fun facts to fascinate a fellow fellow, celebrate the first day of Spring, or the last man on the moon.
Yoto Daily can even tell you what the weather will be each day, which is actually really cool.
Got a library of 5,000 songs already? No problem - simply upload an album through the app and we’ll send you a Yoto card to make it play (or you can decorate your own 'mix tape' cards with stickers).
Want to record your own version of the The Three Little Pigs? Who wouldn’t? - just fire up the app and get huffing and puffing!

Got grandparents who miss the little ones in between visits? Sounds like us - if you download the app for them, recording a personalised story is as easy as making a phone call. And since the story is on the card, your child can hear it over and over again, whenever they like.

Yoto started with a hunch, that there must be a way to bring music and stories - and even connected content - to our own children without having to resort to phones and screens, and without having to dig the old CD player out of the loft.
But we knew we needed to test our ideas with other families, so we could be sure we were on the right track.
We’ve been sharing Yoto prototypes with families for the last two years, and without wanting to blow our own trumpet, we know it works.
We’ve seen early toddlers starting to explore a world of audio with nursery rhymes and animal sounds, right up to great big tweens getting hooked on science podcasts.
But don’t just take our word for it, watch our early prototype testers explain their experience with Yoto.
RFID Card Slot - cards activate content with RFID technology
Raspberry Pi - we are proud to use this wonderful mini (full) computer in Yoto
16x16 pixel LED display - 256 pixels allows us to illustrate basic concepts without getting in the way of the audio experience
WiFi - Yoto connects to Wifi to stream live radio and to download new content
5W Audio - Yoto sounds good - no tinny sound here
Illuminated Surfaces - the side and top surfaces of Yoto can illuminate to help bring audio content to life
Buttons - two simple buttons allow you to skip content forward or back, and to adjust the volume
A Word on OpennessWe don't believe in closed, proprietary technology or walled gardens so we plan to make Yoto as open a platform as possible, with APIs to allow developers to interface with Yoto.

Yoto was founded by Ben and Filip back in 2015 with a vision to make exciting technology and music products that kids can control without screens. Along the way, we have assembled a team of experts from the worlds of content, product design, technology, marketing and manufacturing as well as an experienced set of advisers and investors.
Our team has a strong track-record in building companies and delivering software and hardware projects.
Tom, our Industrial Designer, is a Red Dot Design Award winner and has developed products that Apple chose to sell on its Apple Store.
Ben helped build dotmusic (bought by Yahoo!) and then founded a digital music platform called 7digital - taking it public in 2014
Filip is our technology whizzkid and created the 7digital API - used by companies like Samsung and Spotify
Anthony founded and sold music marketing agency Frukt
Carly has worked at Disney and Sony and has delivered projects for Lego and Kidzania
Sarah is a ‘DigitalMum' and co-founder of the Great British Mums network
Yoto is first and foremost a labour of love for all of us, and we are taking a values-driven approach to everything we do.

We want the best for our children, and we want the best for your children, too. As a way to capture this way of thinking, we have started compiling the Yoto Manifesto, which is our promise that we'll always stay true to what we believe:
It's been quite a journey to get here. The last two years has consisted mainly of: burning our fingers on the soldering iron in Filip's shed
column3: trying not to cry as our prototypes got mauled by toddlers
column4: feeling elated as our improvements started to work
column5: and raising enough money to keep the lights on, and our dreams alive.

column1: Along the way, we've been lucky to have support from friends, family and generally nice people to help us out, and for that we're truly grateful.
Here are some photos from our journey over the last two years...
We're determined to deliver a great product to our backers, and to do so on time. And our team has years of experience delivering hardware projects, so this is not our first rodeo.

Because we know - as the saying goes - hardware is hard, we've been developing Yoto from the outset with manufacturing in mind. And for a while now we've been speaking with our trusted network of partners - like plastics tooling and moulding people, and electronics design and manufacturing specialists - to help us develop a design that flows smoothly into production. We plan to make the first batch of Yoto right here in the UK, so that we can be on the ground to work closely with these partners, and get Yotos to our backers quickly.

We have a Press Kit for journalists and bloggers. Or you can email us directly at hello@yotoplay.com or get in touch by social media. We need your help to tell people about Yoto! Please share our campaign with your friends and families.
Yoto on Facebook  Yoto on Twitter
Thanks for taking time out to discover Yoto. Please back us and help us get the word out.
With gracious thanks, Ben, Filip, Tom, Anthony, Carly and Sarah and the families behind Yoto.

This campaign would not have been possible without the help of many people. A special thanks to Luke, Gideon, Bernie and Sarah and the Roald Dahl Literary Estate team, Rob and the BEAR team, Bart, Alex, Phoebe @ Objekt Films, Dave @ David Burton Photography, Jon, Paul and Niko @ Pimoroni, the team at Machines Room, Edspace, Jan @ Emerge, Tom @ BleepBleeps, Stephen Somerville, Alyssa Tisné, Helena Ambrosio, Steve Redmond, Ania, Peter Papp, Nina, Sofie + Lily, Susan and kids, Rob and kids, Chris Sice, Paul Ashton, Alex Johnston, Rainy Dias, Nina Mistry and many more...",33.0,3,"1 Campaign

0,"

Thank you to everyone who supported us!  You have all been a huge help in the journey to convert ViVi from a side project to a product that can be enjoyed by many more people in the future.

Our Indiegogo campaign, and the crowdfunding phase of business for Visual Vibes, is complete.  All existing orders will ship by the end of May.

We will not be accepting any new orders during May, not here, not there, not anywhere.  We will be shipping all existing orders and getting everything set up to start sales on Amazon.

For the latest information check the updates section here, or visit our website https://visualvibes.io

column2:
>

ViVi is the world's first music reactive LED controller that produces elaborate, well-synchronized visuals without the need to manually program them yourself and with easy plug-in connectors for quick setup.

VibeSync Technology - Music Reactive Lighting. Zero Programming.

Welcome to the age of automation! ViVi’s proprietary sound analysis technology thinks beyond the “grey zone” (brightness based on volume) like other music led controllers and provides precision beat matching across 3 EQ frequencies.

Fits In Your Hand &
column3:
Easy To Use

ViVi is portable, versatile and easily expandable so you can “Bring Your Music to Light” any way you want. You only need one ViVi controller to manage up to 12 addressable LED strips. 

Control From Your Phone.

No more flimsy remotes! Easily customize ViVi right from your phone with our easy to use Vibelink Bluetooth control. The Android/iOS compatible app can easily adjust the visual displays to match strip length so all the animations look professional and clean.

Made In The USA

ViVi is created with the help of multiple manufacturers across the United States and the final assembly and packaging is done at Visual Vibes in Virginia Beach.
column6: >ViVi is Changing the Future of Live Lighting Control
column10:
> 

ViVi can liven up any party, impress your friends, or wow a crowd all for a fraction of the cost of existing products and without the endless hours of setup and programming.
column11:
>

Install it in your house, add excitement to your bar, control lights in your car, strap it to your bike, or use it in your mobile DJ light setup.

1. Audio Port - Connect to AUX or MIC (3.5mm) and ViVi can automatically decipher music DNA into our exclusive VibeSync technology

2. Power - Plug into a 5V adapter or use a barrel jack USB cable to take ViVi on the go (USB battery power not included)

3. VibeSync Connectors - Featuring 3 unique outputs for each EQ frequency (bass/mid/treble), ViVi works with addressable LED strips and can control up to 12 strips (using splitter cables)

4. Accessory Port - An optional port that allows us to enhance ViVi's capabilities to work with various other LED enhancing technologies

All ViVi Music LED Controllers include a standard accessory kit:

column1: • (3) LED Strip Adapter Cables - connect standard WS2812B LEDs with ease (JST 3-pin)
• (1) External 3.5mm Wired Microphone - to pick up sound from external sources
• (1) 3.5mm Audio Splitter Cable -  easy setup for line-in audio input and pass-through
• (1) USB-to-5V DC Power Cable - use with a USB power bank for portability
• (3) 6.5ft/2m LED Strip Extension Cables - gain flexibility and creativity

column2:
>

Tech Specs

Dimensions: 2.4"" x 3.8"" x 1.0"" (61 x 95 x 25 mm)

Weight: 2.0 oz (56 grams)

Voltage: 5 Volts (input and output)

Current Draw: 65 mA (controller only, does not include LED strips)

Max Output Current to LEDs (Passthrough): 5 Amps
column3:
LED strips can be powered directly/separately if more power is needed

Audio Input: 3.5mm jack
column4:
mic-level, instrument-level, or line-level

# of LEDs: control up to 1,500 unique LED addresses
column5:
can control 1,000's more LEDs by splitting the output signal and having multiple strips show same effect

Supported LED Types: WS2811, WS2812, WS2812B, WS2813

Bluetooth Version: 4.2

VibeSync brings Music LED Controllers into the Age of Automation

Autonomous cars drive through traffic, robots vacuum your floor, but LED controllers still blink erratically to music. ViVi combines advanced hardware and software to make setup easy and display amazing shows instantly. Currently to create high-quality light shows you need to program then run software on a computer, connect that to at least one DMX controller, and connect that controller to light fixtures.

ViVi eliminates programming and minimizes setup with everything being automated by our exclusive VibeSync Technology.
column6:
>

VibeSync allows ViVi to work right out of the box and beat sync with any song – seamlessly. Similar light shows can require 3 months of programming for just one song.

ViVi's 3 independent outputs can be split to control up to 12 LED strips, making your creativity the only limitation.

How DJs Use It

In the video below, a DJ uses the ViVi Music LED controller with all 3 outputs.
column10: >This setup split the treble (highs) between two different LED strips for a larger setup
column11:
> 

Versatility

Our free Bluetooth App can easily switch ViVi to static color modes with all the settings of basic LED strip controller plus special animations that take advantage of the Addressable RGB LED strips. ViVi can overhaul any existing lighting installation and gives you the control to bring the fun out when it's time to party.
column12:
>

The Lights

The ViVi Music LED controller can communicate with WS2813, WS2812B, WS2812, and WS2811 LED light strips. These addressable lights are all widely available from retailers online in various form factors (such as LED strips, string lights, and individual LED pads).

It would be difficult to offer rewards tailored to every person's specific desire, so for the initial crowdfunding campaign we will be providing WS2812B LEDs in a silicone sleeve
column13: these lights are IP67 rated and the silicone sleeve also helps prevent sharp bending when being set up and handled.
column15:
> 

Visual Vibes will include LED lights that have been certified and test to work perfectly with ViVi Music LED controller through our perk offerings. We will also have other accessories available through our website before the first ViVi units start shipping. Unless you are familiar with LED lighting strips, you should our starter, +4, or +6 perk.

If you already own addressable LED lights or choose to purchase lights separately, we will be happy to answer your questions to ensure your lights work with ViVi. We'll release an FAQ in the coming weeks to help provide more info.

Setup and Connections

In 3 easy steps ViVi will start the show:

column1: • Plug in audio to the 3.5mm jack using an AUX connection or the included microphone
• Plug in 5V power to the standard barrel jack, use our USB cable or 5V wall adapter

column2:
>

ViVi instantly starts the show with its default settings for easy use out of the box.  

You can then open the VibeLink Bluetooth app and adjust the options and strip length to match your setup and mood perfectly.  All these settings are saved automatically, so you don't need to reset the strip length or other options every time you use ViVi.

In the video below ViVi uses all three outputs and one output is split to two different light sets.  The treble is going to both the light strip on top of the bar and the string light in the plant in the corner (the string light was WS2811 and the color data was GRB instead of RGB, so it shows different colors but the same effect).
column5:
showinfo=0"">

 

VibeLink Bluetooth App

Easily adjust the color, animation, max brightness, and more with the free ViVi Controller app. There are millions of possible configurations to fine tune ViVi to match your exact preferences, or you can choose dynamic modes that let ViVi continuously change the show for you.
column6:
>

Development Progress

ViVi was developed over the past 7 years, with the majority of time being spent on the VibeSync music analysis software. The ever-changing hardware remained on a breadboard and in 2015 we decided on Addressable RGB LEDs as the primary output to finalize our hardware configuration.

We created a few iterations of production prototypes with a custom PCB and enclosure and tested the unit through multiple environments - including DJ gigs, club venues, and even the Burning Man festival.   

In October of 2017 after a long arduous pre-production planning, we started mass production in the United States. Until this point, all components for early prototypes were hand assembled, but we are now using pick-and-place machines for faster assembly and ramped up production.  

One of our proudest accomplishments is to keep all manufacturing and production within the United States - making it one of the rare products to be made locally.

We started shipping in December 2017, but due to issues with the final shipment of enclosures and a bug we introduced (and have now fixed) when adjusting voltage protection settings we had to pause shipping for a few weeks, but we are now shipping again!  Due to the large backlog of orders we have waiting to ship out, new orders will not ship instantly.
column10: >Custom Cables and Other Accessories
column14: >Many more ready to assemble and some ready to ship
column16:
>Big pile of LED strips (in boxes) and Shipping Boxes (in boxes) and more enclosures (in boxes)

Meet the Team

We’re a team of music lovers who thrive the energy and visual sensations during a concert, club, or festival. We’ve seen firsthand how lighting can set the mood and complement rhythms of the music to make it a special atmosphere. This desire for sense-heightening experiences has led us to create a new generation of unprecedented music synchronized light show products that are easy-to-use and create new memories. Our goal is to make the power of music visualization to be available to everyone who wants their next event to be an experience.

Over 2 years of hard work and dedication has given us the pleasure to introduce our creation: The Most Versatile Music LED Controller. EVER.

beamit is a sleek and compact Bluetooth audio transmitter that seamlessly streams Hi-Fi digital audio wirelessly from your TV or wired music system to your favorite pair of Bluetooth headphones or speakers.
Also it's a Hi-Fi Bluetooth music receiver that streams high quality audio wirelessly from any Bluetooth enabled smartphone, computer or tablet to any music system or powered speakers.

Incorporating the high quality aptX® LOW LATENCY audio streaming codec and digital TOSLINK connection, beamit provides Hi-Fi digital audio streaming to up to two Bluetooth headphones or speakers simultaneously.

column2: >
column7: s=6ae2b9dae1d5584b8d4e3054a93efada"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: beamit uses the finest Bluetooth 4.1 technology to stream clear, distortion-free digital audio from your TV, smart device or laptop to Bluetooth enabled headphones, speakers, and other receivers up to 33 feet away.

beamit supports Advanced Audio Coding (AAC), aptX® and aptX® LOW LATENCY Bluetooth audio codecs for high fidelity, low latency audio with aptX®-enabled headphones. Bluetooth 4.1 with aptX® and AAC codecs gives you uncompromising wireless sound, delivering full-range dynamic sound with crystal clarity.
Products with aptX®  |  Products with aptX® LOW LATENCY

The delay between your TV and speakers is a common problem within many wireless audio solutions. aptX® LOW LATENCY technology reduces this latency down to less than 40 ms, eliminating lip-sync issues to give you the smoothest audio/visual experience available.

beamit will provide the best possible audio quality and minimize audio latency only when used with headphones or receivers that support aptX® Low Latency technology. Otherwise, beamit will default to the best codec that is supported by the headphones or receivers connected to it.

Designed to stream real-time audio to two Bluetooth headphones simultaneously, beamit is the perfect solution for users to watch shows, listen to songs, or play games on their TV with someone else at high volume, without disturbing other people in the room.

column2: >
column7: s=839f3dffb1f88cda3bcc8c03e93ae137"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: beamit even lets you stream wirelessly to two Bluetooth enabled speakers at once, for a supreme stereo setup.
Featuring both digital and analog audio Inputs and Outputs, beamit provides the widest compatibility to a wide variety of devices (eg. old and new TVs, stereo systems, etc. )

It seamlessly connects with any device with Optical (TOSLINK S/PDIF), RCA or 3.5mm stereo audio output like TV's, home audio systems, laptops, digital streaming boxes (including Apple TV and Amazon Fire TV), etc.
beamit conveniently draws power from the included micro USB charging cable that can be plugged into any powered USB port such as USB wall adapter, computer, or recent TVs and sound systems.
beamit operates either as a transmitter or a receiver. Switch easily between transmitter mode (TX) and receiver mode (RX) with the flick of a button located at the back of the device.

In TX mode, beamit can wirelessly stream audio from a non-Bluetooth device (HDTV / Computer) to any Bluetooth audio receiver that supports the A2DP Bluetooth profile, such as a Bluetooth headphone, Bluetooth speaker, or dedicated A2DP receiver.

column2: >
column7: s=935461eb02a04beb33729935f9a4c2a3"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: In RX mode, beamit enables wireless audio streaming from any Bluetooth enabled smartphone, computer or tablet to any non-Bluetooth music system or powered speakers.

column2: >
column7: s=14a6da13c6f78353b7c81c30ffd0adcf"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: Pairing any headphone, speaker or smart device to beamit is simple and effortless.
Just slide and hold the spring-loaded Multi-function Switch on the front of the unit briefly to the right and release, it automatically goes into pairing mode.

column2: >
column7: s=ebd3a1b15abefd619ff8ec20be38d60e"" src="""" style=""""/>

column2: >
column7: s=caba4888ae00ff81e2e21fbc7478f43a"" src="""" style=""""/>

column1: After pairing, select your desired audio Input (Optical ↔ Aux) by sliding the Multi-function Switch and that’s it - you’re ready to stream from any of your favorite devices.
The sleek and compact beamit has been thoughtfully designed to look great and completely blend in any setting without taking up too much space.
beamit can be conveniently mounted on your TV, home audio systems, computer, car dashboard or work desk with the hassle-free, non – adhesive sticky gel mounts.
With every Auris product, you receive our 1-year Limited Warranty. For more details, see the warranty section of our website.
Interested in featuring our story? HERE you will find everything you need, including High Res video and images. For further inquiries mail us at sales@theauris.com

At Auris, our philosophy is about empowering our innovative creative streak to enhance user experience. Team Auris wouldn’t be here today if it weren’t for backers like you who kickstarted our first product auris freeDa: Bluetooth for your Dock in 2012, auris skye: WiFi for your Dock in 2013 and auris bluMe True Hi-Fi Bluetooth Music Receiver in 2015.
We are a team of friends, designers, engineers, audio geeks, and operations experts bound together with one sole purpose in mind: creating audio solutions that simplify and enhance modern lifestyle.

Creation is our mantra – we use your valued input to form a foundation for our technique and master each design using a number a factors and key elements of the music lifestyle. Our creations are a part of our commitment to our consumers and we strive and work on to diligently improve upon their experiences and much more.

column1:
Risks and challenges

We have built a few functional prototypes and extensively tested them. As this is our fourth time launching a product on Kickstarter, issues should also be minimal.

We are confident about keeping to our shipping schedule. However, if there are unintended delays during the manufacturing process we will always be transparent and inform our backers, then plan an appropriate course of action.

Please note that International backers will be responsible for paying any duties or taxes levied in their home country.

Thank you for your support!


","beamit is a sleek and compact Bluetooth audio transmitter that seamlessly streams Hi-Fi digital audio wirelessly from your TV or wired music system to your favorite pair of Bluetooth headphones or speakers.
Also it's a Hi-Fi Bluetooth music receiver that streams high quality audio wirelessly from any Bluetooth enabled smartphone, computer or tablet to any music system or powered speakers.

Incorporating the high quality aptX® LOW LATENCY audio streaming codec and digital TOSLINK connection, beamit provides Hi-Fi digital audio streaming to up to two Bluetooth headphones or speakers simultaneously.
beamit allows you to use any headphones or speakers to enjoy high fidelity wireless audio.

beamit uses the finest Bluetooth 4.1 technology to stream clear, distortion-free digital audio from your TV, smart device or laptop to Bluetooth enabled headphones, speakers, and other receivers up to 33 feet away.

beamit supports Advanced Audio Coding (AAC), aptX® and aptX® LOW LATENCY Bluetooth audio codecs for high fidelity, low latency audio with aptX®-enabled headphones. Bluetooth 4.1 with aptX® and AAC codecs gives you uncompromising wireless sound, delivering full-range dynamic sound with crystal clarity.
Products with aptX®  |  Products with aptX® LOW LATENCY

The delay between your TV and speakers is a common problem within many wireless audio solutions. aptX® LOW LATENCY technology reduces this latency down to less than 40 ms, eliminating lip-sync issues to give you the smoothest audio/visual experience available.

beamit will provide the best possible audio quality and minimize audio latency only when used with headphones or receivers that support aptX® Low Latency technology. Otherwise, beamit will default to the best codec that is supported by the headphones or receivers connected to it.

Designed to stream real-time audio to two Bluetooth headphones simultaneously, beamit is the perfect solution for users to watch shows, listen to songs, or play games on their TV with someone else at high volume, without disturbing other people in the room.
When streaming to two headphones/speakers, beamit will default to the best available codec.
beamit even lets you stream wirelessly to two Bluetooth enabled speakers at once, for a supreme stereo setup.
Featuring both digital and analog audio Inputs and Outputs, beamit provides the widest compatibility to a wide variety of devices (eg. old and new TVs, stereo systems, etc. )

It seamlessly connects with any device with Optical (TOSLINK S/PDIF), RCA or 3.5mm stereo audio output like TV's, home audio systems, laptops, digital streaming boxes (including Apple TV and Amazon Fire TV), etc.
beamit conveniently draws power from the included micro USB charging cable that can be plugged into any powered USB port such as USB wall adapter, computer, or recent TVs and sound systems.
beamit operates either as a transmitter or a receiver. Switch easily between transmitter mode (TX) and receiver mode (RX) with the flick of a button located at the back of the device.

In TX mode, beamit can wirelessly stream audio from a non-Bluetooth device (HDTV / Computer) to any Bluetooth audio receiver that supports the A2DP Bluetooth profile, such as a Bluetooth headphone, Bluetooth speaker, or dedicated A2DP receiver.

AUDIO INPUTS are used with TX MODE ONLY – When in TX mode beamit needs an audio source to transmit. It must be fed an audio signal from a connected device such as a television, video game system, computer, mp3 player, etc.
In RX mode, beamit enables wireless audio streaming from any Bluetooth enabled smartphone, computer or tablet to any non-Bluetooth music system or powered speakers.

AUDIO OUTPUTS are used with RX MODE ONLY – When in RX mode beamit is receiving an audio signal and passing that signal from its output to the input of some type of ampliﬁcation device like a home stereo, bookshelf speaker, car audio, etc.
Pairing any headphone, speaker or smart device to beamit is simple and effortless.
Just slide and hold the spring-loaded Multi-function Switch on the front of the unit briefly to the right and release, it automatically goes into pairing mode.
It will pair automatically with any headphone or other Bluetooth receiver / speaker that is also in pairing mode and located within 1 meter (3 feet).
In case of a smart device, simply activate Bluetooth, select ""auris beamit"" from the list of available devices.
After pairing, select your desired audio Input (Optical ↔ Aux) by sliding the Multi-function Switch and that’s it - you’re ready to stream from any of your favorite devices.
The sleek and compact beamit has been thoughtfully designed to look great and completely blend in any setting without taking up too much space.
beamit can be conveniently mounted on your TV, home audio systems, computer, car dashboard or work desk with the hassle-free, non – adhesive sticky gel mounts.
With every Auris product, you receive our 1-year Limited Warranty. For more details, see the warranty section of our website.
Interested in featuring our story? HERE you will find everything you need, including High Res video and images. For further inquiries mail us at sales@theauris.com
